title: Why do we study humanities? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is important, especially in grade school, to have students take a variety of courses, or at least have them available, to help them and schools decide on what would be the best careers. That includes STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math), Social Sciences, Humanities, Arts and Music, Shop (hands on courses), Physical Education, ROTC, and Recess (to examine Montissorri education). These can be experienced at various times during the twelve grades, and even extended into Arts and Sciences undergraduate colleges if desired.

To learn about history and why things are the way they are. The logic behind way things are the way they are. I took that class and hated it but I understood it was one of those classes that made sense to learn about. I felt the same way about humanities as I did taking an advanced math class like College Algebra.
